author: DeltaBravo
title: Toyota’s fuel-cell big rigs are ready to haul cargo
summary: After completing 4,000 "development" miles at the port of Los Angeles, Toyota's Project Portal hydrogen fuel-cell big rig is ready to start transporting cargo from that port and the one in Long Beach to rail yards and warehouses beginning on October 23.

author: DeltaBravo
title: GM to Temporarily Close Detroit Auto Plant
summary: General Motors will temporarily close a plant in Detroit and subsequently cut production at the facility upon its re-opening.

author: DeltaBravo
title: First used Tesla Model 3 hits Craigslist... for $150,000
summary: In the event you're browsing Craigslist with $150,000 to burn, there's a used Tesla Model 3 with your name on it. A Tesla Model 3 has appeared in a Craigslist post from Monterey, California. The car allegedly has about 2,000 miles on the odometer. As with every other Model 3 in production, it's a long-range version with the 310-mile battery, and other features include the panoramic glass roof, upgraded sound system and "Aero" wheels. The seller notes that "a unique circumstance" spurred the for-sale posting. It's currently listed for $150,000, or approximately 3 times the car's initial cost. It's not eligible for the $7,500 federal tax credit because it's already been registered, and good luck

title: Royal Wheels: A Closer Look at How the British Royal Family Likes to Get Around
summary: From the mundane to the outrageously opulent, the British royal family has seriously interesting taste when it comes to cars.

title: Temple University Student Killed By Miami Police After Hitting Cop With Car
summary: Video that has been circulating on social media shows the chaotic moment an officer fatally shot 22 year old Cariann Denise Hithon, after she drove her vehicle into a crowd and ran over a police officer in South Beach on Sunday.

author: captainunderoos
title: Richard Spencer warns Charlottesville to brace itself for more white supremacist protests
summary: Richard Spencer has urged Charlottesville to prepare for more white supremacist “flashmobs” after leading a march by torchlight on Saturday in Charlottesville. The leading white supremacist, who rose to fame for being punched at an anti-trump protest, helped to organise a march in the Virginia city on Saturday. This follows the “Unite the Right” rally which saw Neo-Nazis, KKK members, and “alt-right” supporters descend on Charlottesville in August clutching flaming torches, assault rifles and wearing paramilitary clothing.

author: captainunderoos
title: A 757hp Corvette station wagon? We love the Callaway AeroWagen
summary: Here at Ars, I've made no secret of my love for wagons or my regard for the current generation of Chevrolet Corvette. Now, thanks to the clever people at Callaway Cars, it's possible to get both of those in one carbon-fiber package: the Callaway AeroWagen. The AeroWagen is the latest product from a company that has been tuning Corvettes—with GM's blessing and warranty—for the past three decades. The coolest bit is that the carbon fiber AeroWagen hatch is a straight swap for the stock rear hatch of the current C7 Corvette. The modification will bump the 'Vette's cargo capacity by a couple of cubic feet, but perhaps more importantly, it transforms what was already one of the best-looking front-engined

author: third_watch
title: The 13 Fastest Modern Muscle Machines
summary: Modern muscle cars have built upon the foundation laid out by their predecessors in the 1960s and 1970s. Here are the 13 fastest muscle cars of the 2010s.

author: nanook
title: California DMV changes rules to allow testing and use of fully autonomous vehicles
summary: The California Department of Motor Vehicles is changing its rules to allow companies to test autonomous vehicles without a driver behind the wheel -- and to let the public use autonomous vehicles.

title: Cadillac’s hands-free feature fixes the worst parts about driving
summary: The 145-mile jaunt between Flagstaff, Arizona, and Phoenix is almost entirely downhill.

author: nanook
title: 2018 Ford Mustang used duct tape to improve aero, efficiency
summary: Everyone likes to joke that duct tape solves every problem, but for the engineers working on the 2018 Ford Mustang, it actually did solve a problem. Ford tells the story like this: During track testing, its engineers experienced too much front-end lift, which can compromise steering efficacy. An aerodynamics engineer slapped a piece of duct tape over the grille's lower gap, the front-end lift was eliminated and the car handled much better around corners. Anyone who's ever coded something can attest that one small change in one place can have far-reaching effects everywhere else. The subsequent adjustments to the 2018 Mustang's front end, including a larger front splitter, a lower nose and active

author: rocky.j.mountain
title: 2018 Ford Mustang EPA ratings improve — except for EcoBoost with Performance Pack
summary: Mileage numbers go down for that configuration.

author: DeltaBravo
title: Nvidia Is Only Up 600% and Goldman Sachs Thinks More Explosive Gains Lurk
summary: Nvidia stock is not done going higher, says Goldman Sachs analyst Toshiya Hari, who boosted his price target to $217 from $193 to go along with his conviction buy rating.

author: ipostwhaticareabout
title: Hyundai Mounts Charm Offensive at U.S. Dealers to Stem Slump
summary: Hyundai Motor Co., mired in a sales slump, is turning on the charm offensive to combat decades of buyer frustration at America's car dealers. Dealerships in four U.S. cities will implement reforms including posting more transparent price and discount information online and offering three-day money-back guarantees. The program also allows buyers to schedule a test-drive when and where they want and to complete most paperwork on the web to reduce time spent at the dealership. “I don't have to tell you we're undergoing a paradigm shift when it comes to how people are buying cars,” Dean Evans, Hyundai Motor America's chief marketing officer, said at a press conference broadcast online. The auto industry

author: DeltaBravo
title: Dubai Airport Is Installing Face-Scanning Tunnels
summary: The additional security present in airports around the world is a necessary frustration to travelers. Security checks take time, which means long waits before your journey can continue. The whole process can be very slow, but Dubai International Airport is trying to speed things up by replacing security checkpoints with a tunnel. As The National reports, the tunnel is being referred to as a "virtual border." As each passenger walks through the tunnel 80 cameras mounted inside attempt to scan their face. On the sides of the tunnel images of a virtual aquarium will be displayed in order to attract each person's attention. Looking at the sides of the tunnel allows the cameras to get a better view

author: captainunderoos
title: Venus Williams Car Crash: Autopsy Reveals Fatal Injuries
summary: Venus Williams Car Crash Autopsy Reveals Fatal Injuries 1 10/10/2017 3:38 PM PDT The man killed in the Venus Williams car crash suffered major internal injuries -- including lacerated organs and broken bones in his back ... this according to the autopsy obtained by TMZ Sports.  The Medical Examiner has released the report regarding 78-year-old Jerome Barson -- who was in the passenger seat of a 2016 Hyundai which slammed into Venus' Toyota Sequoia on June 9.  The reports shows Barson was rushed to the hospital with a lacerated spleen, a tear in his small intestine, damage to his colon, a broken pelvis and multiple spinal fractures.  The ME says Barson remained in critical condition in the hospital

author: ipostwhaticareabout
title: Red Line trains stopped twice in half-hour because of people on tracks
summary: Red Line trains stopped for about 20 minutes Tuesday evening as CTA crews dealt with a "person on the tracks" at the Chicago Avenue stop, only to stop again minutes after that situation was resolved because of someone else on the tracks at the Roosevelt Road station. The first incident happened 5:55 p.m. and was resolved by about 6:20 p.m., according to CTA Tweets. Trains stood in the area while crews dealt with the situation. Minutes after the first incident was resolved and trains began moving again, trains were stopped briefly because of a person on the tracks at the Roosevelt Road station. Trains were moving again throughout the State Street Subway by a little before 6:30 p.m., but with major

author: ipostwhaticareabout
title: Woman arrested in fatal hit-and-run of man in wheelchair
summary: An Alabama woman has turned herself in to police for a hit-and-run accident that killed a handicapped man in a motorized wheelchair. Christina Marie Carroll of Florence, Alabama was booked on charges Tuesday for leaving the scene of an accident resulting in death, Al.com reported. Police said that an SUV fatally struck Kevin Allan Doherty, 57, while he was traveling Friday night in his motorized wheelchair. Doherty was airlifted to Huntsville Hospital, where he was pronounced dead. Carroll, 26, was arrested at Lauderdale County Courthouse after the police asked the public for help identifying the driver. “Witnesses that observed the crash described the vehicle as a small SUV,” Florence Police

author: rocky.j.mountain
title: Aerojet Rocketdyne To Build Zero-to-Mach-6 Engine
summary: (Image: Concept image of Lockheed Martin's planned SR-72 hypersonic strike aircraft to serve as a replacement for the SR-71 Blackbird.) DARPA recently selected Aerojet Rocketdyne to build a new type of aircraft engine that would allow flight at hypersonic speeds up to Mach 6, according to Aviation Week. Under DARPA's Advanced Full Range Engine (AFRE) program, Aerojet Rocketdyne has been contracted to demonstrate the viability of a turbine-based combined cycle engine (TBCC), which uses a conventional turbojet for relatively low-speed flight and transitions to a ramjet and scramjet to accelerate from about Mach 3 to the target speed of Mach 6. It is not yet clear what aircraft DARPA has in mind

author: DeltaBravo
title: Report: Motorist falls short in bid to jump car over canal
summary: LEHIGH ACRES, Fla. (AP) — Authorities say a man tried to jump his car over a canal in a Florida neighborhood, but didn't make it.

author: rocky.j.mountain
title: San Jose police persuade man to come down from Highway 101 overpass
summary: SAN JOSE — Police officers persuaded a man who acted as though he was going to jump off the McKee Road overpass on Tuesday to safely come down. At 10:49 a.m., motorists on Highway 101 saw a man “who looked like he was going to jump” standing on the McKee overpass of Highway 101, according to San Jose Police Officer Gina Tepoorten. Patrol officers immediately responded to the scene. Police negotiators were also called to talk with the man. At 12:01 p.m., the man safely came down, Tepoorten said. All lanes of northbound 101 near McKee were closed and all but one southbound lane was closed for about one hour.

author: DeltaBravo
title: Ford Should Consider Axing These 5 Lame Cars as It Slashes $14 Billion in Costs
summary: Ford CEO Jim Hackett said the automaker will shift investments away from passenger cars as it looks to reduce costs.

author: nanook
title: 10 Forgotten Pickup Trucks That Never Made It
summary: Some pickups have bloodlines that go back generations, and inspire lifelong loyalty among customers. Others get forgotten. These 10 have been forgotten.

author: DeltaBravo
title: Lamborghini Aventador S Takes on Miami in New Ignition
summary: The Aventador has transformed from a strictly straight-line performer to a more livable supercar that gladly tackles corners and winding mountain roads. Unfortunately, its newly acquired skills won't prove too helpful when we drive it over the flat terrain of Florida, but the Aventador S shines in other ways. On the latest episode of Ignition, host Jonny Lieberman shows us why the Aventador S is great for places like Miami. First, Lieberman hits South Beach in an Aventador S with an entourage of other high-profile Lambos, including an extremely rare Veneno coupe. An Aventador SV also shows up, boasting just 10 more hp than the Aventador S. Packing a 6.5-liter V-12, the Aventador S delivers 730

author: ipostwhaticareabout
title: 10 of the Sexiest Sports Cars You Can Buy for Under $30,000
summary: These 10 beauties prove that world class looks and performance can be had by almost everybody. These are the sexiest sports cars under $30,000.

author: ipostwhaticareabout
title: New US-made electric SUV has six doors and retro looks
summary: The future of SUVs is starting to look more and more like the past. Following this summer's reveal of the retro-style Bollinger Motors B1 battery-powered truck concept, Georgia-based Green4U Technologies has announced plans to put a six-door, 4x4 electric SUV into production next year. It rides on an aluminum truck chassis designed by Green4U, an electric vehicle company that was launched last year by Don Panoz, the founder of namesake sports car builder and engineering firm Panoz LLC. Green4U CEO Jack Perkowski tells Fox News that the MTU-6 has a projected range of up to 230 miles per charge and is being targeted at commercial customers looking for a zero-emissions, off-road capable truck.

author: ipostwhaticareabout
title: One dead in head-on crash on Highway 17 in Los Gatos
summary: LOS GATOS — At least one person was killed in a head-on crash Monday night on Highway 17, according to the CHP. The collision occurred just after 6 p.m. near The Cats Restaurant and Bar in Los Gatos. CHP Officer Ross Lee said it appeared as though a one-ton truck heading northbound crossed over into southbound lanes and hit a vehicle head-on, killing at least one person. Two other vehicles were involved in the crash, Lee said. Additional information about the collision, including additional fatalities and injuries, was not immediately available. The collision has closed one northbound lane and all southbound lanes of Highway 17. With no estimated time to reopen the lanes, motorists are advised

author: rocky.j.mountain
title: NVIDIA unveils next-generation platform for fully autonomous cars
summary: Silicon Valley graphics chipmaker NVIDIA unveiled on Tuesday the first computer chips for developing fully autonomous vehicles and said it had more than 25 customers working to build a new class of driverless cars, robotaxis and long-haul trucks. Deutsche Post DHL Group, the world’s largest mail and logistics company, and ZF, a top automotive parts supplier, plan to deploy a fleet of autonomous delivery trucks based on the new chips, starting in 2019, NVIDIA said. The third generation of NVIDIA’s Drive PX automotive line, code-named Pegasus, is a multi-chip platform the size of car licence plates with datacenter-class processing power.

author: captainunderoos
title: Mitsubishi's turn signals of the future are projected on the road
summary: Mitsubishi's experimental Safe and Secure Lighting system takes turn signals to the next level.

author: DeltaBravo
title: Here’s When BMW and Other Automakers Will Abandon Gasoline
summary: Hybrids and EVs make up a small percentage of cars on the road. But that's going to change very soon. Here's when these automakers plan on going electric.
